Class BaseList

java.lang.Object
BaseList
Direct Known Subclasses:
CourseList, StudentList
public abstract class BaseList extends Object
An abstract list class that stores objects implementing the Searchable interface. Provides basic functionality such as adding, retrieving, and checking size. Prevents duplicate entries and dynamically resizes the internal array as needed.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(Object obj)
      Adds a new object to the list if it is not already present. Only allows objects that implement the Searchable interface. Automatically grows the internal list if capacity is exceeded.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to add
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the object does not implement Searchable

    • get

      public Object get(int index)
      Retrieves the object at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the object
      Returns:
      the object at the specified position
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the current number of elements in the list.
      Returns:
      the size of the list

    • growList

      private void growList()
      Doubles the capacity of the internal array and copies over existing elements.

    • findMatch

      public abstract Object findMatch(String key)
      Finds and returns the first object in the list that matches the given key. Implemented by subclasses based on specific matching logic.
      Parameters:
      key - the search key
      Returns:
      the matching object, or null if no match is found

    • query

      public abstract BaseList query(String key)
      Returns a new list containing all objects that match the given key. Implemented by subclasses with their specific type and match logic.
      Parameters:
      key - the search key
      Returns:
      a BaseList containing all matching elements

    • contains

      public abstract boolean contains(Object obj)
      Determines whether the specified object is already in the list. Implemented by subclasses using their equality logic.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to check for
      Returns:
      true if the object exists in the list; false otherwise
